intro: Rosa pimpinellifolia var. adenophora, commonly known as the腺花玫瑰, is a variant of the rock rose, characterized by its compact growth habit and dense foliage. It produces clusters of small, fragrant pink or white flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. It is often used in rock gardens due to its hardy nature and ornamental value. The variety is distinguished by its glandular hairs on the stems and leaves, giving it a unique appearance.
